intro: Xeronema, commonly known as the tree of heaven, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its distinctive, often twisted trunk and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces woody, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. Xeronema thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitat.
